channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Covid-19 update: Four new cases - two community and two imported
item.description: Two new community cases revealed today are connected to a returnee who tested positive for Covid-19 after completing the 14-day managed isolation process, and one is a student at an Auckland school.

item.title: NZ's largest ever medical marijuana crop gets the go-ahead
item.description: A Marlborough medicinal cannabis company has secured a licence to grow New Zealand's largest ever crop.

item.title: Battle for surrogate son leaves parents broken-hearted
item.description: The parents of a 6-year-old boy born to a surrogate mother in China and embroiled in an immigration battle are set to be reunited with their son.

item.title: Foreign yachties say lives now at risk from NZ decision
item.description: Foreign yachties seeking refuge in New Zealand from seasonal Pacific cyclones are baffled by the response not to let them in.

item.title: Auckland Harbour Bridge damage: 'You can't build your way out of it forever'
item.description: It's still not known how long the Auckland Harbour Bridge will be partially closed to traffic, says NZTA's senior journey manager.

item.title: Person seriously injured after shooting in Oropi
item.description: A man has been arrested after shots were fired in a rural district in the Bay of Plenty overnight.

item.title: 'An insult': disability services provider fumes over tiny rise in funding
item.description: A disability services provider is furious with the government for what it says is a paltry funding increase, despite a big deal being made about extra money in the May Budget.

item.title: Arrests made after Christchurch shooting incident
item.description: Three men have been arrested in relation to yesterday's firearms incident in Christchurch.

item.title: 'No guarantee': Engineers target temporary fix for harbour bridge
item.description: Engineers are assessing the damage and working on a temporary solution to reopen some centre lanes of the Auckland Harbour Bridge after a truck toppled by high winds hit a key structure.

item.title: Covid-19 update: One new community case, one imported case
item.description: There has been one new community case of Covid-19 reported in New Zealand today - the first in five days.

item.title: Man critical after shooting in Christchurch
item.description: A man is in a critical condition in hospital after being shot in Christchurch.

item.title: Backpackers with STA Travel visas plead for access to promised jobs
item.description: Backpackers in New Zealand who bought visas from companies connected with STA Travel are pleading with immigration officials to let them access the jobs they were promised.

item.title: More than 2000 Aucklanders report water breaches
item.description: Aucklanders have grabbed the chance to dob in people they believe have breached the region's water restrictions.

item.title: Early learning centres 'reluctant to charge any more of a fee to parents than is necessary'
item.description: Many early learning centres are looking to draw on their own cash-strapped resources to survive Covid-19, rather than increasing fees for parents.

item.title: Traffic still delayed on Auckland Harbour Bridge
item.description: Traffic on the Auckland Harbour Bridge is making slow progress this morning as delays continue, after a truck toppled and damaged the superstructure yesterday.

item.title: Gulf Livestock 1: 'Every possibility that they are alive waiting to be rescued'
item.description: A spokesperson for one of the men missing at sea says it is possible that the crew made it onto the raft and have washed up on a nearby island.

item.title: Five arrested as police continue search for escaped murderer
item.description: Five people have been arrested in relation to the escape of the convicted murderer Katrina Epiha, who has still not been found.

item.title: Jacinda Ardern says NZ benefits from refugee community: 'We are the lucky ones'
item.description: A new group that aims to be a voice for the migrant and refugee community to engage with the government and other policy makers was launched last night.
